content.description:
Use deep rail and small underclings to work your way out to the lip to your right. From there, traverse left on increasingly good holds. Once you have reached the obvious left lift, throw far up, and back to make a hard mantel. Tops out up and left through dirty blocks

 Back wall off on start
content.location: Starts in the back of the roof cave to left of the trail and Stickbug.

content.description: Sds on the left facing mail slot hold, working up and slightly right through meathooks, sloppers, and slots. Mantel through the two ledges with a surprisingly heady mantel at the top.
content.location: To the right of the trail when you step down with the short, fixed rope. Across from The Way cave

content.description: Use a good left hand jug and a small right hand lip to mantel up to the slab. Work through under clings and flakes to work towards the arete and top out on two consecutive jug ledges.
content.location: The slab to the right of Fish Fillet. Shares topout

content.description: Short, easy off width/chimney. Good to get a feel for how the wider cracks down the hill might feel.
content.location: To the left of Blowtorch Arete

content.description: SDS with both hands on small shelf and surprisngly good feet on either side of the "arete". Use the rail to make it to slopers before reaching over to topout. Topout provides an amazing view of the valley and is what makes this climb worth doing.
content.protection: One or two pads, fall isn't too far but uneven
content.location: Lower overlook.Pass stickbug and turn right near the Blowtorch towards the edge of cliff. You will run into one overlook, turn left and walk down to second overlook.

content.description: Start low on a crimp rail and a right hand nub on the arete. Compress up through right hand slopers and left hand jugs in the crack to a floundering topout at the ledge. Climb up left and out from there
content.protection: A few pads, watch out for the stump and bush behind you
content.location: From the blow torch arete, walk down two or three steps towards the main crag, and pass through a ledge with a lichen covered boulder on your right. Problem is in the nook behind that boulder

content.description:
Offwidth/squeeze chimney

 Grade is size dependent, crux is getting established in the thing. Super worth hopping on if you like a grovel
content.protection:
Pads and spotters 

  Would be hard to fall out of but the landing isn’t great
content.location: Down the hill from Blowtorch Arete, on the overlook block. Opposite side from Push to Start boulder.

content.description:
High Topout! Great Holds! Bad Landing!

 Start on lowest huge rail. Work through jugs to a heady rock-over move on small feet, and then copout on highest point of the boulder.
content.location: Huge arete overhanging the left side of the trail

content.description: Small cluster of boulders on the hike in. A great spot to warm up, with the opportunity for a few harder problems.
